# Stage 1: Lakeshore Trail Repair - Invitation to Qualify
## Overview
The Parks Canada Agency invites interested contractors to submit their bids for the Stage 1: Lakeshore Trail Repair project, which is part of a two-stage selection process. The project involves repairing approximately 2.5 km of raised trail tread, creation of drainage infrastructure, and erosion control measures along the shoreline of Riding Mountain National Park.

## Important Dates
*   Tender closing date: April 18th, 2024, at 16:00 hours
*   Expected contract start date: August 19, 2024
*   Expected contract end date: January 31, 2025

## Evaluation Criteria
The selection committee will evaluate the bids based on lowest price, taking into account the project's scope, pricing, and other predetermined factors.

## Eligibility Requirements
Bidders must meet the following requirements to be eligible:

*   Possess the necessary qualifications, licenses, and certifications to perform the work
*   Demonstrate experience in similar projects
*   Meet the Indigenous business participation requirements

## Tendering Process
This is a two-stage selection process. Bidder must submit a bid in two stages; 

*   This posting is the first stage (Stage One) of a two-stage solicitation process: 
    *   The first stage will evaluate the qualifications of all interested suppliers 
    *   The second stage will invite the qualified suppliers to provide a financial bid on the project based on the specifications and drawings 

## Submission Guidelines
Bidders can submit their bids by email or fax to the contact person listed below.

### Email Submissions
*   Email should be sent to: 
    *   soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca
*   Attachments should be no larger than 15 MB

### Fax Submissions
*   Fax should be sent to: 
    *   1-855-983-1808

### Time and Date of Receipt
All submissions will be time-stamped and dated. Late submissions will not be considered.

### Notification of Award
Bidders will be notified shortly after the closing date.

## Contact Information
For any inquiries, contact:
